title: Ticket #5548: per-job history file contains the same attribute multiple times
description:
When writing the per-job history file, attributes that were updated while the job is running appear twice.f

This is because we serialize the Cluster and per-proc chained classads into the file. We need to merge these in-memory before writing to the file.
remarks:
2016-Mar-16 15:07:28 by jfrey:
Code Review

In sPrintAd(), the argument to LookupIgnoreChain() can be itr->first (without the call to c_str() ). That will eliminate a possible copy of the attribute name.

Otherwise, this looks good.

2016-Mar-16 16:59:03 by tannenba:
Code review issue addressed in commit [48043]

Resolving.
check_ins:
2016-Mar-16 16:57   Check-in [48043]: Eliminate unneeded deep-copy of a string. #5548 (By Todd Tannenbaum )
2016-Mar-15 18:12   Check-in [48035]: Added version history blurb for #5548 (By Todd Tannenbaum )
2016-Mar-15 17:14   Check-in [48031]: Avoid duplicated attributes in serialized ClassAds. #5548 This patch changes sPrintAd() to avoid printing out the same attribute multiple times when the ad has a chained parent. This was causing users grief in, for instance, per-job history files. (By Todd Tannenbaum )
creator: zmiller
